Class SFDCEncoder

public class SFDCEncoder

This class is a basic encoder/escaper to help prevent some XSS attacks etc.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

SFDCEncoder

public SFDCEncoder()
Method Detail

SFDC_HTMLENCODE

public String SFDC_HTMLENCODE(String input)
Similar to the VisualForce HTMLENCODE function.

Example:
 //htmlstr is going to be sent to visualforce as html code
 htmlstr = '<div>' + ESAPI.encoder().SFDC_HTMLENCODE(unsafe_text) + '</div>';

SFDC_JSENCODE

public String SFDC_JSENCODE(String input)
Similar to the VisualForce JSENCODE function.

Example:
 //htmlstr is going to be sent to visualforce as html code
 htmlstr = '<script> var str = "' + ESAPI.encoder().SFDC_JSENCODE(unsafe_text) + '";</script>';

SFDC_JSINHTMLENCODE

public String SFDC_JSINHTMLENCODE(String input)
Similar to the VisualForce JSINHTMLENCODE function.

Example:
 //htmlstr is going to be sent to visualforce as html code
 htmlstr = '<div onclick=\'alert("' + ESAPI.encoder().SFDC_JSINHTMLENCODE(unsafe_text) + '");\'>some text</div>';

SFDC_URLENCODE

public String SFDC_URLENCODE(String input)
Similar to the VisualForce URLENCODE function.

Note : This function always encodes into UTF-8 URL encoding - if you need another encoding type, use the second function which allows to set the encoding.

Note : Even when using this function you should still not trust the input as a full URL because it may have JS or load data from other domains. this function just makes sure the input is encoded as proper URL.

Example:
 //htmlstr is going to be sent to visualforce as html code
 htmlstr = '<img src=\'http://domain/' + ESAPI.encoder().SFDC_URLENCODE(unsafe_text) + '\' />';

SFDC_URLENCODE

public String SFDC_URLENCODE(String input,
                                       String encoding)
Similar to SFDC_URLENCODE(String input) but allows to set specific encoding type.

Example:
 //htmlstr is going to be sent to visualforce as html code
 htmlstr = '<img src=\'http://domain/' + ESAPI.encoder().SFDC_URLENCODE(unsafe_text, 'ISO-8859-1') + '\' />';
